awd_titl_txt: Photodissociation, Recombination, and Vibrational Relaxationin Molecular Cluster Ions
awd_abstract_narration: In this project in the Theoretical and Computational Chemistry                  Program of the Division of Chemistry, investigations are being                  carried out to elucidate the mechanisms of photodissociation,                   geminate recombination, and vibrational relaxation of diatomic                  negative ions imbedded within molecular clusters.  These ions                   include diatomic halogen anions solvated by carbon dioxide                      molecules.  The methods of electron transfer theory are being                   combined with molecular dynamics simulations to study the                       interplay between charge localization and solvation.                            %%%                                                                             Molecular ions in the gas-phase can become "solvated" by                        surrounding neutral molecules in much the same way as metal                     ions become "solvated" by water molecules in aqueous solution.                  In this study theoretical and computational methods are being                   used to characterize such clusters and their interactions with                  light.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
